record.field.name: legacy.suspend
record.file.name: slamodulecontrol

brief.brief: If selected (set to true), Service Manager measures responsiveness based on the response Service Level Targets (SLTs) of the record by using the legacy method, which does not consider the state progression order of the record.
If cleared (set to false), Service Manager uses another method for responsiveness measurement, which takes the state progression order of the record into account.

detail.detail: Suppose the following SLT is defined for Incident records:
Suspend processing for these states: Pending Vendor, and Pending Change
The response state progression order in the slamodulecontrol definition for Incident is as follows: Open, Pending Vendor, Work In Progress, Pending Change, Resolved, and Closed

When this option is selected, once an incident record moves to a suspending state, the running SLT will be suspended directly without checking its order in the response states list or phase list. For example, when the record moves to either the Pending Vendor state (which is before the final state) or the Pending Change state (which is after the final state), the running SLT is suspended.

When this option is not selected, when the record moves to the Pending Vendor state (which is before the final state), the running SLT is suspended; however, when the record moves to the Pending Change state (which is after the final state), the running SLT is achieved.
